data.title: The Plague by Camus Albert, First Edition
data.meta_description: The Plague by CAMUS, Albert and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Hardback. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. Kitson, Linda (illustrator). First edition. 1st thus 1987. Slightly better than very good condition with no wrapper. Introduction by Derek Parker. Terracotta cloth, pictorial onlay to front cover. Pictorial endpapers. B/w illustrations. Top edge red. Front endpapers have been glued together during the binding process, title block to spine slightly rubbed. Else a lovely copy contained in publisher's slipcase which is just slightly grubby (VG+). Packaged with care and promptly dispatched!.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good-. Dust Jacket Condition: No Dust Jacket. 1st Edition (Unstated); Second Printing. 248 pages; Foxing (light) to the exterior edge of pages only. No slipcover included. Very light spill stains to front cover. Otherwise in great condition. No writing or noteworthy blemishes. ; - We offer free returns for any reason and respond promptly to all inquiries. Your order will be packaged with care and ship on the same or next business day. Buy with confidence.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. First Printing. Book in solid, tight condition, unmarked aside from small owner name opposite fly leaf. Dust jacket price-clipped, with minor wear to corners/spine ends, toning to rear panel; has been placed in new mylar sleeve.

THE PLAGUE (ML#109.1, FIRST PRINTING, MODERN LIBRARY EDITON)

CAMUS, ALBERT,CAMUS, ALBERT, Written By (1903-1960) French philosopher, author, dramatist, and journalist. He was the recipient of the 1957 Nobel Prize in Literature at the age of 44, the second-youngest recipient in history.

Published by New York: Modern Library. 1948, First Modern Library, First Printing, 403 Titles inside DJ.,

Seller: Shepardson Bookstall, Brookline, MA, U.S.A.

Seller Rating:

Contact seller

First Edition

Used - Hardcover

Condition: Very Good

£ 54.16

Convert currency

£ 37.12 Shipping

From U.S.A. to Germany

Quantity: 1

Add to basket

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. 1st Edition. BROOKLINE BOOKSTALL, 20 YEARS OF EXCELLENCE. Pictorial DJ covered in mylar to protect; top and bottom edges worn; soiling on back; chips on top and bottom edges; with 403 titles listed on inside. BOOK: Bright Kelly green boards #8; clean Kent Endpapers. STORY: A plague epidemic in the large Algerian city of Oran. In April, thousands of rats stagger into the open and die. When a mild hysteria grips the population.

8vo., First Edition thus, with full-page ilustrations in the text and pictorial endpapers; terracotta cloth, upper board with illustration in panel, gilt back, red top, a near fine copy in unclipped dustwrapper.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Sixteenth Printing. Nice copy. Inscribed nicely to friend or relative by former owner on front endpaper. No other markings. Tight and square. Price clipped jacket has some creasing at spine ends and top of front fold but no chips, tears or soiling. In mylar. Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Modern Library Edition. First Printing. Toledano 109.2* A Fine copy in green cloth, in a Fine grey, black and orange dustwrapper, not price-clipped, with 403 titles listed on verso. Translated from the French by Stuart Gilbert. 278pp. Nobel Prize winner. Q18012.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. First Edition. First UK Edition, 1948. Translated From the French by Stuart Gilbert. Publication of 285 pages. Supplied with a good facsimile dust jacket. The boards are a little edge worn, remain in good condition. There is light foxing on the block of the book. Internally the pages are clean and complete. Tightly bound and presented in cellophane. The binding is excellent. GK. Our orders are shipped using tracked courier delivery services.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. 1st Edition. Hardcover. Black cloth over boards, faded gilt lettering to spine. Title page dated 1950. This is the fifth printing of the first edition. 278 pages. Good condition. Covers clean and square, but spine sunned. Binding strong. The intrepid reader that came before you made fairly regular (but neat) notes in the margin throughout. They used ink for the first 20 pages, which has faded somewhat, and then thought better of it and switched to pencil.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine to Fine. Sixteenth Printing. Nice copy. Crisp, unread copy. Unmarked, tight and square. Tape ghosts to front and rear endpapers and black boards but neat as there is no residue. Book is otherwise fine. Price intact is close to fine but for small residue where price sticker removed over front flap where jacket price is now clear. In mylar. Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

Octavo hardcover. No jacket. 3rd Printing. An acceptable reading copy copy of the 3rd printing of the first edition without its jacket. Fair with worn and dulled boards showing tears to the corners. Pages lightly toned but free of marks or stains.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Ex-Library copy with typical library marks and stamps. First edition THUS. Shelf and handling wear to cover and binding, with general signs of previous use. This is the 1948 First American Edition published by Knopf and translated by Stuart Gilbert. Boards betray fading and nicks and other signs of wear and imperfection commensurate with age. Binding is tight and structurally sound. Interior pages with text without any extraneous marks. Dust jacket adhered to the boards by the enlightened librarians. Secure packaging for safe delivery. 1.04.
